txt.en: Woe of the Willow -- Solo
The wood-trolls are corrupting the forest.\n\nYou should defeat their leader, Gulmúk Dampmould.
The road to Old Man Willow has taken you deep into the Old Forest.\n\nYou should pick up the summoning horn to call Marigold to your side.
'Let's go. Keep an eye out for spirits.'
'Well, never mind. It's time we went home and gave the Bounders good news.'
'Everything looks so... twisted. Like the forest itself is angry.'
'But if we strike it with everything we've got, even iron has to break.'
'Hm. I learn something new about my friend Tom every day!'
Defeated Gulmúk Dampmould
'Isn't that --'
Destroyed the Morgul blade
'Let's bring the forest back to normal!'
TBD
'Old grey Willow-man, mind you your mischief! Go now back to sleep, and don't be a-waking!'
'Intruders! Do not let them near the fell spirits!'
'Protect the spirit!'
'I'll scout ahead and wait for you. Keep an eye out for spirits, and follow the river if you get lost!'
Pick up the summoning horn
TBD
'There's Old Man Willow. And... you see that? A sword!'
'I don't like the look of that sword one bit! And I don't think we ought to touch it, either!'
'We've got further to go before we reach the sword -- and Old Man Willow.'
'The path splits here. We ought to check the other way for foul spirits and the like.'
TBD
'You cannot stop the march of Angmar. Thadúr will see it done!'
'Hey dol! Merry dol!'
'Ha! Ha! Thorn or sword -- Tom sees no difference!'
<rgb=#60DE4B>The gloom of the forest lifts momentarily</rgb>
TBD
'Pesky vermin... these woods are ours!'
'The sword can't be too far from here.'
TBD
'But... Thadúr... promised....'
TBD
Destroy the sword
DNT - Tier 2 Roots
TBD
Use the summoning horn to call Marigold
TBD
TBD
Defeat Gulmúk Dampmould
'Spirits? We'll keep a sharp eye out! Thank you kindly for telling us!'

In the heart of the Old Forest, a fell sword calls forth evil spirits from the Barrow-downs. Only by destroying the sword can you stop the wood-trolls' blight from spreading and end the forest's misery.
'The path splits here. You ought to check the other way for foul spirits and the like. Don't get lost!'
'Phew! That'll teach them not to underestimate us!'
Though the wood-trolls have lost their leader, fell spirits continue to flock to the Old Forest.\n\nYou should destroy the sword that has been summoning the spirits.
